intro: Cobaea hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant produces trumpet-shaped blooms that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. Its vines can grow up to several meters long, often climbing supports or other structures. The leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while the fruits are capsules that contain numerous seeds.
